item.title: European Union votes to ban petrol, diesel car sales by 2035

item.title: Coffee trumps economic crisis as Tim Hortons opens in Pakistan
item.description: Inflation in January spiked to 27% year-on-year, the highest in more than a decade, and the government only has enough foreign reserves to pay for just over three weeks of imports.
item.itunes:title: Coffee trumps economic crisis as Tim Hortons opens in Pakistan

content:encoded.p: Inflation in January spiked to 27% year-on-year, the highest in more than a decade, and the government only has enough foreign reserves to pay for just over three weeks of imports.

item.title: Walmart plans on scaling back its footprint, decides shutting 3 tech hubs
item.description: Tech offices will be shut in Austin, Texas; Portland, Oregon; and Carlsbad, California, Global Chief Technology Officer Suresh Kumar said in a memo last week.

content:encoded.p: Tech offices will be shut in Austin, Texas; Portland, Oregon; and Carlsbad, California, Global Chief Technology Officer Suresh Kumar said in a memo last week.

item.title: Ford is investing $3.5 billion in EV battery plant with Chinese firm: Report
item.description: The factory near Marshall, Michigan, will employ 2,500 workers, Ford said Monday. The facility is set to open in 2026 and will produce enough batteries to power 400,000 EVs a year.
item.itunes:title: Ford is investing $3.5 billion in EV battery plant with Chinese firm: Report

content:encoded.p: The factory near Marshall, Michigan, will employ 2,500 workers, Ford said Monday. The facility is set to open in 2026 and will produce enough batteries to power 400,000 EVs a year.

item.title: Frederick Barclay threatened with bankruptcy over £100 million divorce award
item.description: Frederick Barclay is yet to pay a penny of the divorce award, according to a lawyer for Hiroko Barclay, who told a London court on Monday her legal team was left with little choice but to prepare a bankruptcy petition against the “completely unrepentant” tycoon.
item.itunes:title: Frederick Barclay threatened with bankruptcy over £100 million divorce award

content:encoded.p: Frederick Barclay is yet to pay a penny of the divorce award, according to a lawyer for Hiroko Barclay, who told a London court on Monday her legal team was left with little choice but to prepare a bankruptcy petition against the “completely unrepentant” tycoon.

item.title: Adani Group tries to calm market amid share rout: 'business plans fully funded'
item.description: Market value of the group's seven listed companies has halved since a January 24 report by US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research alleged that Adani pulled "the largest con in corporate history" using offshore tax havens and stock manipulation.
item.itunes:title: Adani Group tries to calm market amid share rout: 'business plans fully funded'

content:encoded.p: Market value of the group's seven listed companies has halved since a January 24 report by US-based short-seller Hindenburg Research alleged that Adani pulled "the largest con in corporate history" using offshore tax havens and stock manipulation.

item.title: IIP growth declines to 4.3% in December 2022: NSO data
item.description: The manufacturing driven slowdown in IIP growth between November and December suggests that the dissipation of festive/pent-up demand could have played a role in industrial activity losing momentum, even as capital and infrastructure spending continue to support growth.
item.itunes:title: IIP growth declines to 4.3% in December 2022: NSO data

content:encoded.p: The manufacturing driven slowdown in IIP growth between November and December suggests that the dissipation of festive/pent-up demand could have played a role in industrial activity losing momentum, even as capital and infrastructure spending continue to support growth.

item.title: Delhi-Mumbai Expressway: PM Modi unveils first stretch; Check Toll price, speed limit
item.description: The Delhi-Mumbai Expressway connecting the national capital to the financial capital has 40 interchanges that will improve connectivity to Jaipur, Kishangarh, Ajmer, Kota, Chittorgarh, Udaipur, Bhopal, Ujjain, Indore, Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat.

item.title: Amazon, Flipkart among 20 online sellers issued notices for selling drugs without licence: Report
item.description: The show-cause notice dated February 8 by DCGI V G Somani cited a Delhi High Court order dated December 12, 2018, which prohibits online sales of medicines without a licence.
item.itunes:title: Amazon, Flipkart among 20 online sellers issued notices for selling drugs without licence: Report

content:encoded.p: The show-cause notice dated February 8 by DCGI V G Somani cited a Delhi High Court order dated December 12, 2018, which prohibits online sales of medicines without a licence.
